Explanations about Options.-d(M): A synonym for -depth, for compatibility with FreeBSD, NetBSD, MacOS X and OpenBSD.
Explanations about Options.-mtime(M):
File's data was last modified n*24 hours ago. See the comments for -atime to
 understand how rounding affects the interpretation of file modification times.
Explanations about Options.-name(M):
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.

Explanations about Options.-c(M):
Add one-line comments for each file. File operations (adding, updating) are done
 first, and the user is then prompted for a one-line comment for each file. Enter
 the comment followed by return, or just return for no comment.
Explanations about Options.-d(M): Remove (delete) entries from a zip archive. For example:
Explanations about Options.-f(M):
Replace (freshen) an existing entry in the zip archive only if it has been modified
 more recently than the version already in the zip archive; unlike the update option
 (-u) this will not add files that are not already in the zip archive. For example:
Explanations about Options.-v(M): Verbose mode or print diagnostic version info.
Explanations about Options.-z(M):
Prompt for a multi-line comment for the entire zip archive. The comment is ended
 by a line containing just a period, or an end of file condition (^D on Unix, ^Z on
 MSDOS, OS/2, and VMS). The comment can be taken from a file:

au_909065: #!/bin/bash

cd /home/etc/recycle_old           #Deletes old trash
rm -r ./*

cd /home/etc
mv -r ./recycle ./recycle_old      #Moves new trash to "old"-folder
